tossupQ:
CHEMISTRY  Short Answer  Name the elements in the following reaction that have been 
oxidized and reduced, respectively:  Zn(solid) + CuSO<sub>4</sub>(aqueous)  ZnSO<sub>4</sub>(aqueous) + Cu(solid)
tossupA: OXIDIZED = Zn (ACCEPT:  ZINC);  REDUCED = Cu (ACCEPT:  COPPER)
bonusQ:
CHEMISTRY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is closest to the pKa of an acid whose pKa = 5.0 × 10<sup>-4</sup>: 
 
W)  2.3 
X)  3.3 
Y)  4.0 
Z)  5.0

tossupQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following best describes the repressor protein in the 
lac (read as: LACK) operon: 
 
W)  uncompetitive inhibitor 
X)  structural protein 
Y)  regulatory protein 
Z)  transcriptional factor
bonusQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Through which of the following mechanisms do allosteric 
inhibitors typically operate: 
 
W)  binding the substrate 
X)  binding to an enzyme’s active site 
Y)  binding to a site other than the active site and changing the shape of an enzyme  
Z)  acting as a competitive inhibitor and overpowering the active sites of enzymes
bonusA:
Y)  BINDING TO A SITE OTHER THAN THE ACTIVE SITE AND CHANGING 
THE SHAPE OF AN ENZYME

tossupQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  In the radioactive decay scheme of uranium, what is the final stable 
element produced?
bonusQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  Consider an astronaut on the Moon and g is exactly 1/6th of g on Earth. 
If he threw an object vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 1.6 meters per second, how many 
meters up would it be after 1 second, rounding your answer to the first decimal place?

tossupQ:
MATH  Multiple Choice  Which of the following represents the inverse function of f(x) = x<sup>3</sup> + 5: 
 
W)  (x – 5)<sup>3</sup> 
X)  x<sup>3</sup> – 5  
Y)  (x-5)<sup>1/3</sup>  Z)  (1/(x-5))<sup>3</sup>
bonusQ:
MATH  Short Answer  Giving your answer in meters squared, find the total surface area of a 
right prism whose base is a right triangle with legs of length 3 meters and 4 meters and whose 
altitude is 2 meters:
bonusA:
36 
 
(Solution: 3:4:5; P<sub>base</sub> = 3+4+5 = 12m; A = ½bh = 6 m<sup>2</sup>;  TA = LA + 2B = (12)(2) + 2(6) = 36 m<sup>2</sup>)

W)  cottonwood

Y)  aspen  
Z)  black spruce

arctic environment that is likely to be surrounded by a ring of so-called drunken trees leaning toward

X)  thermokarst

tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE  Short Answer  Order the following 3 hexadecimal numbers from 
SMALLEST to LARGEST:  3E8;  BB<sub>8</sub>;  1F<sub>4</sub>;
bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  An experiment aboard a recent Space Shuttle mission 
exposed Salmonella typhimurium (read as: TIE-fee-muhr-EE-um) to a space environment.  Which of 
the following resulted when the bacteria came back to Earth: 
 
W)  they were more virulent 
X)  they were less virulent 
Y)  they had about the same virulence 
Z)  they changed into a new but similar species of bacteria
bonusA:
W)  THEY WERE MORE VIRULENT 
(Solution: NASA’s Space Shuttle mission STS-115)

tossupQ:
ASTRONOMY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is TRUE of red supergiants: 
 
W)  some form Cepheid variables 
X)  most end as nova stars 
Y)  most have luminosities about 10 to 100 times that of our Sun 
Z)  most have surface temperatures at least 2-times that of our Sun
bonusQ:
ASTRONOMY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is NOT characteristic of B-type stars 
like Rigel or Spica (read as: SPY-kah): 
 
W)  very luminous 
X)  apparent blue color 
Y)  medium strength hydrogen spectral lines 
Z)  average solar mass of about 3.2
bonusA:
Z)  AVERAGE SOLAR MASS OF ABOUT 3.2 
(Solution: solar mass of about 16-18)

tossupQ:
CHEMISTRY  Multiple Choice  According to VSEPR bonding theory, if 2 of the bonded atoms 
in an octahedral molecule are replaced by 2 electron pairs, the molecule will assume what geometric 
shape, such as in XeF<sub>4</sub>: 
 
W)  linear  
X)  trigonal bipyramidal 
Y)  square planar 
Z)  square pyramidal
bonusQ:
CHEMISTRY  Multiple Choice  According to VSEPR bonding theory, if one of the bonded 
atoms in a trigonal bipyramidal molecule is replaced by 2 electron pairs, the molecule will assume 
what geometric shape, such as in ClF<sub>3</sub>: 
 
W)  t-shaped  
X)  see-saw 
Y)  linear 
Z)  bent

tossupQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following mutations would most likely affect a gene 
the LEAST: 
 
W)  single base deletion  
X)  single base substitution 
Y)  single base insertion 
Z)  quadruple base deletion
bonusQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following BEST explains why a single base 
substitution in a gene-coding region for amino acids will sometimes lead to no change in amino acid 
sequence: 
 
W)  all nucleotides are subject to the same mutation rate 
X)  some nucleotide bases are covalently joined by stronger bonds 
Y)  the code is degenerate with more than one triplet coding for the same amino acid 
Z)  some amino acids act in the same fashion in determining the tertiary structure of a protein
bonusA:
Y)  THE CODE IS DEGENERATE WITH MORE THAN ONE TRIPLET CODING 
FOR THE SAME AMINO ACID

tossupQ:
PHYSICS  Multiple Choice  Which of the following experimental approaches was used by 
scientists to discover that the atomic nucleus held most of the atom’s mass and a positive charge: 
 
W)  directing alpha particles at thin metal strips 
X)  finding the amount of magnetic deflection in cathode rays within a well-evacuated tube 
Y)  exposing photographic film to certain radium salts 
Z)  using a crude cyclotron to disintegrate large nuclei
tossupA: W)  DIRECTING ALPHA PARTICLES AT THIN METAL STRIPS
bonusQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  Name all of the following 4 sub-atomic particles that are never found 
in isolation:  electrons;  protons;  quarks;  positrons

EARTH SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  Placodonts, which lived during the Triassic Period, were a 
group of: 
 
W)  meat-eating land reptiles 
X)  flying reptiles 
Y)  small, lightweight, plant-eating reptiles 
Z)  marine reptiles
bonusQ:
EARTH SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is NOT true regarding seismic 
waves through the Earth: 
 
W)  P-waves travel through the mantle 
X)  S-waves travel through the mantle 
Y)  P-waves travel through the outer core 
Z)  S-waves travel through the outer core
bonusA:
Z)  S-WAVES TRAVEL THROUGH THE OUTER CORE 
 
(Solution: S-waves cannot travel through liquids and the outer core is liquid)

tossupQ:
PHYSICS  Multiple Choice  Which of the following would a Leyden jar most likely be 
considered: 
 
W)  an electroscope 
X)  a capacitor 
Y)  a resistor 
Z)  a Tesla cage
bonusQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  How many joules of energy are used by an electrical appliance 
operating on 8 amps of current flowing through a 20-ohm resistance circuit for 5 minutes?
bonusA:
384,000  
 
(Solution:  E = I<sup>2</sup> R × T = (8A)<sup>2</sup> × 20 ohms × 300 s = 384,000 joules)

tossupQ:
ASTRONOMY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following BEST describes where the zodiacal 
light is brightest to a stargazer at mid-northern latitudes: 
 
W)  within about 20 degrees of the ecliptic  
X)  at the western horizon at sunrise 
Y)  at right angles to the Milky Way 
Z)  parallel with the Milky Way
tossupA: W) WITHIN ABOUT 20 DEGREES OF THE ECLIPTIC
bonusQ:
ASTRONOMY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is the BEST explanation for what 
causes zodiacal light: 
 
W)  reflection of moonlight off the Earth’s surface 
X)  dispersion of the Earth’s radiant heat off the troposphere 
Y)  sunlight reflected off interplanetary dust particles 
Z)  radiation from the Van Allen belts
bonusA: Y)  SUNLIGHT REFLECTED OFF INTERPLANETARY DUST PARTICLES

tossupQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following BEST explains why leaves fall off trees in 
the autumn: 
 
W)  the leaves die and passively fall off  
X)  an abscission layer forms at the base of the leaf stem causing it to fall off 
Y)  the leaves slowly dry out from the bottom up because of abscisic acid that prevents phloem from 
delivering nutrients 
Z)  the vascular tissue of the leaves fill up with resin increasing their stiffness and causing them to 
become brittle
tossupA:
X)  AN ABSCISSION LAYER FORMS AT THE BASE OF THE LEAF STEM 
CAUSING IT TO FALL OFF

Y)  frame shift mutation 
Z)  inversion mutation
